title: Vaccinium vitis-idaea
summary: Vaccinium vitis-idaea, the lingonberry, partridgeberry, mountain cranberry or cowberry, is a small evergreen shrub in the heath family Ericaceae, that bears edible fruit. It is native to boreal forest and Arctic tundra throughout the Northern Hemisphere, from Europe and Asia to North America. Lingonberries are picked in the wild and used to accompany a variety of dishes in Northern Baltoscandia,[2] Russia, Canada and Alaska. Commercial cultivation is undertaken in the U.S. Pacific Northwest[3] and in many other regions of the world.[4]
